name: Hilton Lisle / Naperville

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice hotel in the Naperville / Wheaton area. Being a gold Hilton Honors member we were able to stay on the 6th floor where you have to enter your room key in the elevator to gain access to that floor. That was nice since there was a senior prom and a class reunion going on there that night.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.text: When checking in, the front desk person wasn't very friendly. Not sure if he was just having a bad day because of all the people there or what.
reviews.title: Comfortable Stay at Hilton Lisle

reviews.text: The rooms were very clean and comfortable.
reviews.title: Fabulous service at an outstanding facility

reviews.text: As for location, you'll have to drive to go anywhere. There are a few hotels not too far away that are within walking distance to area restaurants and shopping.
reviews.title: Hilton of Lisle

reviews.text: Recently spent two nights at this Hilton while attending a family wedding at the nearby Morton Arboretum. Overall this was a nice property, and while the building is a bit dated, the rooms have been refurbished and are comfortable. I notice that our room was quite a bit larger than what I would normally expect at a typical Hilton property.
reviews.title: In the top ten hotels I have stayed at!

reviews.text: Swirly carpets and blaring muzak - a throwback to a bygone era of hotels. Sandwiched between 2 major roads the hotel is dated. The bedrooms are fine; the bathrooms typical of this kind of american hotel - small and cheap. I eat in the bar one night and had some prawns - chilled to the point of tastelessness and a Mexican dish which also transpired to be tasteless (not a notable aspect of Mexican cooking) On requesting any kind of chlli sauce in the hope of adding taste I was greeted with a puzzled expression. After a hard day in the office I got back to find my bedroom had not been cleaned. I phoned housekeeping who came within a hairsbreadth of accusing me of lying when I said I had not put the "Do not Disturb sign on the door, and then asked me whether I really wanted my room cleaned at this time of the evening. The executive lounge (an overclaim if ever there was one) provided breakfast but nowhere sensible (like a table and chair) to eat it. I will be trying the refurbished Marriott next time.
reviews.title: A throwback

reviews.text: I frequently travel to West Chicago for business, and have stayed at the Hilton Lisle on several occasions. The staff make you feel right at home--very friendly and accommodating. I highly recommend the restaurant; I've had several items off the menu and they've all been gourmet dishes--not what you expect from a hotel restaurant.
reviews.title: Hilton Lisle / Naperville

reviews.text: Clean facilities and friendly staff! Came here for a wedding in the area but the rehearsal dinner and brunch the morning after the wedding was hosted at the hotel. Everything was very well done, and the staff was extremely helpful.
reviews.title: Great Experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was clean, the staff was friendly and close to downtown Naperville. Would love to go back and stay longer! Only complaint was lots of noise in the hallways, it was a Saturday night and we attended a wedding reception there at the hotel so unsure if it was people from the wedding or from another event or other guests. Hotel was pretty busy that wknd but other than that no complaints! Easy check in and check out!
reviews.title: Best in Naperville

reviews.text: This was a very nice hotel. Clean, welcoming staff and a nice restaurant. Very easy check in and check out. Good workout room and nice pool. Good breakfast options. Easy access to the northwest suburbs.
reviews.title: Great hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Vince (from Alaska) at the front desk was fantastic! He was great at welcoming us and what a great attitude whenever we had a request during our stay. He always promptly took care of our requests and then offered to do more. Enjoyed him and the staff until the time we left. We don't get to the Naperville near Chicago are too often, but whenever we do we know we will be staying at this property. When leaving I asked Vince if this was a new property and he told me it was 15 years old and they will be remodeling the guest rooms this year. I was quite surprised because the building and the decor in the lobby, restaurant and bar look like it had just been built this year
reviews.title: Great Place to stay

reviews.text: Of course, it's away from downtown but it will capture your attention. Views from some of the rooms are very, very nice. First time here at this location but one thing for sure, the hospitality is super!
reviews.title: Rainy but Great Views

reviews.text: It seems that the hotel has instituted some new evening venues, which has gotten my attention is a very positive manner.
reviews.title: Excellent service, well maintained.

reviews.text: I will be returning to experience more of the hotel and the wonderful staff.
reviews.title: Older hotel but nice rooms and friendly staff

reviews.text: You can tell that this hotel works hard to maintain the best experience possible for it's guests.
reviews.title: A jewel of a hotel

reviews.text: The room was very clean, up-to-date and comfortable. A thermastat that worked instead of like some other hotel that have a window unit that either runs all night or must be shut off all night. They should include breakfast with the room and the internet was not working, otherwise, a good stay.
reviews.title: Another good stay at the Lisle Hilton

reviews.text: Stayed here for one night during the middle of the week and overall it was very nice, BUT throughout the night groups of people would return and stand at the elevators having loud conversations that carried down the hall. I was about 4 rooms away from the elevators and it sounded like the people were right outside my door. DO NOT get a room on the 1st floor, or least not from like 100-110. Other than that I enjoyed my stay but couldn't sleep too well and that's what I was there for. Hearing how loud it was and what time it was I was surprised no one from the desk asked them to be quiet or move somewhere else....
reviews.title: Comfortable bed, but 1st floor is VERY loud...

reviews.text: Been to this hotel many times, year after year, for a quilt get together. I have stayed here most likely a dozen times. Hotel is great as is most Hiltons brand hotels I have stayed at but the best part is the staff. They same people working there year after year when we comes tells me alot about the place. They always go above and beyond for our group and will do whatever they can to make sure we have a perfect stay. The last time I stayed the place was very busy with several weddings and it was still quiet in my room. Food in the restaurant is always wonderful too. Great hotel!
reviews.title: Always a great stay

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed the weekend and attended a business meeting in one of the conference rooms. It was a great experience, overall. The staff was friendly and helpful. It was easy to get a late meal in the bar and the prices were reasonable. We'd recommend the Hilton Lisle as a great place to stay.
reviews.title: Great place to stay in Naperville

reviews.text: The Hilton Lisle really went above and beyond for our group to ensure our stay was comfortable. From the quick and friendly arrival process, to the upgrade of room for HHonors was excellent. I would recommend this Hotel.
reviews.title: Great Experience

description: Our award winning hotel will surpass your expectations, welcome to the Hilton Lisle/Naperville hotel. Located among Naperville hotels near Chicago, we're positioned just steps from several major corporation offices. Guests can swim laps all year round in our indoor pool, unwind in our whirlpool spa, and stay fit in our fully equipped fitness center. We offer complimentary shuttle bus service to local businesses, and feature an executive floor with executive lounge access. Also featured on property is the local favorite, Allgauer's restaurant. We can accommodate groups/meetings from 10 to 360 people in our flexible event space, perfect for weddings, social, and business events.
